title: Textile With Chef De Piece, 1770–75
medium:
Medium: linen warp, cotton weft plain weave
Technique: block-printed. Blocks for floral stripe: 30.5cm (12 in.) x 16.5cm (6 1/2 in.) Blocks for geometric stripe" 30.5 cm (12 in.) x 10 cm (4 in.) Block marks are visible.
inscribed: At one end of the fabric the factory mark in use from 1762 to 1783. Other block printed marks on front are: MR enclosed in partial box in deep red, partial TS enclosed in pink box, indistinct PP enclosed in box in blueand partially readable numbers including 26 and 94 in grey. On back; IC? enclosed in box in olive and J.I in black; also D3205.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinoe merrell where it was numbered 8A on the Merrell list of chefs.
dimensions:
Warp: 132 cm (52 in.). Weft: 79.5 cm (31 1/4 in.) Both selvedges present.
Pattern: Height of repeat: 30.5 cm (12 in.). Because stripes are offset width of full repeat is not present.
description: Pattern of three floral stripes alternate with three geometric stripes. Colors are: deep red, pink, blue, olive, and black.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile With Chef De Piece, 1770–75.
1770–75. Medium: linen warp, cotton weft plain weave
Technique: block-printed. Blocks for floral stripe: 30.5cm (12 in.) x 16.5cm (6 1/2 in.) Blocks for geometric stripe" 30.5 cm (12 in.) x 10 cm (4 in.) Block marks are visible.. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-8.
